title: Tapestry (Carole King album)
summary: Tapestry is the second studio album by American singer-songwriter Carole King, released in 1971 on Ode Records and produced by Lou Adler. The album was certified 13× Platinum by RIAA[3] and it is one of the best-selling albums of all time, with over 25 million copies worldwide.[4] It received four Grammy Awards in 1972, including Album of the Year. The lead singles from the album—"It's Too Late" and "I Feel the Earth Move"—spent five weeks at number one on both the Billboard Hot 100[5] and Easy Listening[6] charts. In 2000 it was voted number 74 in Colin Larkin's All Time Top 1000 Albums.[7] In 2020, Tapestry was ranked number 25 on Rolling Stone list of the 500 greatest albums of all time.[8]
